title: (x) classic serif headline on The Royal Magazine website - H&FJ Requiem {Mark S}
content:
What is this beautiful serif as displayed on [http://www.theroyalmagazine.com/](http://web.archive.org/web/20071010134510/http:/www.theroyalmagazine.com/ "http://www.theroyalmagazine.com/").  
Thanks in advance.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20071010134510im_/http:/typophile.com/files/royal_serif_5369.png)

 [‹ (x) Looking for a freeware alternative to Letterhead's FireTruck - various {gang}](http://web.archive.org/web/20071010134510/http:/typophile.com/node/33973 "Go to previous forum topic") [Looking for a font that resembles theatre marquee letters ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071010134510/http:/typophile.com/node/33972 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Seadreams

comments.content: Actually, as I look at this more closely, it might be Requiem small caps.
